meanings.definition: In a satisfactory or pleasing manner.
meanings.sent1: She danced agood at the recital.
meanings.sent2: He sang agood in the choir performance.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out agood despite the burnt edges.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone agood on the happy picnic.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed agood in the spring garden.

meanings.sent1: She is known for her agood deeds in the community.

meanings.sent4: His agood heart shines through in his actions.
meanings.sent5: The agood behavior of the students impressed the teacher.

meanings.sent1: Eating fruits and vegetables is agood for your health.
meanings.sent2: Having a positive attitude can be agood in difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: The extra time off work was a agood for the tired employee.
meanings.sent4: A good education is a agood that should not be taken for granted.
meanings.sent5: The support of friends can be a agood during tough times.
